Package actor

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
actor.Actor
actor.Monster
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bug, Frog, PinkBall
public abstract class Monster extends Actor
Represents the generic attributes and behaviors of monsters in the game. This abstract class extends the Actor class, providing common functionalities for all monster types.

  • Method Details

    • checkCollidesWithPlayer

      public void checkCollidesWithPlayer(Actor.Direction direction)
      Checks if the Monster collides with the player when moving in a given direction. If a collision is detected, the player's status is updated to not alive.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction in which to check for collision with the player.

    • flipDirection

      public void flipDirection(Actor.Direction direction)
      Flips the Monster's direction to the opposite direction. For example, if the current direction is UP, it will be changed to DOWN.

    • turnLeft

      public void turnLeft()
      Turns the Monster's direction to the left by 90 degrees. This method adjusts the direction based on a left turn.

    • turnRight

      public void turnRight()
      Turns the Monster's direction to the right by 90 degrees. This method uses a combination of a left turn and flip to achieve a right turn.

    • getPassableTiles

      public String[] getPassableTiles()
      Retrieves an array of tile keys that the monster can pass through. This method overrides the getPassableTiles method from the Actor class.
      Overrides:
      getPassableTiles in class Actor
      Returns:
      An array of strings representing the keys of passable tiles.

    • getDirection

      public Actor.Direction getDirection()
      Retrieves the current movement direction of the monster. This method overrides the getDirection method from the Actor class.
      Overrides:
      getDirection in class Actor
      Returns:
      The current direction of the monster.

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(Actor.Direction direction)
      Sets the movement direction of the monster. This method overrides the setDirection method from the Actor class.
      Overrides:
      setDirection in class Actor
      Parameters:
      direction - The new direction for the monster to move in.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Retrieves the player associated with the monster. This method is used to access the player object, typically for interactions or targeting.
      Returns:
      The Player object associated with the monster.

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(Player player)
      Sets the player associated with the monster. This method allows the monster to interact with or target the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player object to associate with the monster.
